bib_record.title: Fusion cross sections for 6Li+12C and 6Li+13C reactions at low energies

free_txt: Saha institute of nuclear physics.
Erratum
The measurements were done with 6-Li-2+ and 6-Li-3+
beams obtained from the 3 MV pelletron accelerator of
the institute of physics, Bhubaneswar.
Code cascade
Channel and fusion cross sections.
- By compiler. Authors' data for energy in C.-M. system
Were recalculated for beam energy in laboratory system
by compiler.  The authors' data are saved in MISC-COL.O
Two detectors each of 90 cm**3 volume were
placed at 125 and 90 degrees with target-to-detector
distance 12 cm approximately.  The g-ray cross section
were mainly determined from the spectra obtained with
the detector at 125 degrees.  The detector at 90
degrees gave unshifted g-rays and helped in the proper
identification of them.
The uncertainties in beam particles, and the
number of target nuclei are estimated to be 5% and
6.5%, respectively, and in detector efficiency about 7%
giving a combined error of 11%, approximately.  This is
added to the statistical error in the number of gamma
quanta, which also includes the uncertainty due to the
approximation of the background under a gamma-ray peak,
to get the total error.
The measurements were done with 6-Li-2+ and 6-Li-3+
beams obtained from the 3 MV pelletron accelerator of
the institute of physics, Bhubaneswar.
See sample
the thicknesses of the targets were accurately
determined from the elastic scattering spectra obtained
with using 2-4 MeV Li-ions and 10-12 MeV 16-O ions.
The number of beam particles was determined
from the charge collected in the Faraday cup and
dividing it by the equilibrium charge value ze obtained
from J.B.Marion and F.C.Young, Nuclear Reaction
Analysis:  Graph and Tables.
The sum of kinetic energies of projectile and
target nucleus in C.-M. system.                       O
